frontmatter.title: Whatever Happened to the Semantic Web?
frontmatter.desc: In 2001, Tim Berners-Lee, inventor of the World Wide Web, published an article in Scientific American. Since its introduction only a decade before, the web had fast become the world's best means for sharing documents with  other people. Now, the web would evolve to encompass not just documents but every kind of data one could imagine.
